chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey Robert Robinson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Under the IDIP program $1769.00 will with be stayed.  Failure to successfully complete the IDIP program, fine/costs will be assessed at $2147.00.

Sentenced to 6 months in the Pepin County Jail.  Under the IDIP Program, defendant to serve 30 days jail (with good time) with 5 months stayed upon entrance into and successful completion of the IDIP program.  Jail sentence to commence immediately.  Work release privileges granted.
Operating privileges revoked for 30 months.  Under the IDIP program, operating privileges revoked for 24 months with 6 months stayed.  Credit for any administrative suspension.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.

Court finds defendant eligible for the IDIP Program.   Failure to comply with the program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.
AMENDED 03-02-2017:  Defendant successfully completed the IDIP Program.  He maintained his sobriety in the community for 6 months, completed his AODA assessment and is in compliance with his DSP,  performed 60 hours of community service work, and paid all required program costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Robert Robinson

records.addlTxt: Pepin County Sheriff returned documents as requested by Circuit Court Judge.

Letter from Chambers of Circuit Judge advising the defendant successfully completed the IDIP Program.  He maintained his sobriety in the community for 6 months, completed his AODA assessment and is in compliance with his DSP, performed 60 hours of community service work and paid all required program costs. Clerk to make any necessary amendments to the JOC to reflect the IDIP penalties.
Letter from Chambers of the Circuit Judge to Jeffrey Robinson re: IDIP contract.
Letter to Pepin County Sheriff with IDIP Agrmt., etc.

IDIP Agreement:
IDIP Program Requirements:  1)Length of IDIP Agreement.  2)Absolute Sobriety.  3)Monitored Sobriety.  4)AODA Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  5)Payment of IDIP Program Fee.  6)Community Service Work.  7)No violations of law.  8)Other conditions.  9)Violations of the agreement.
Letter to IDIP Coordinator with the draft IDIP Agreement and JOC as the defendant has been approved to participate in the IDIP Program.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey Robert Robinson in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Jeffrey Robert Robinson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss OAR.   Court advises defendant of charge in count 2 - OWI 5th offense/max. penalties. Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed with the court and reviewed with the defendant.  Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, dismiss count 1 OAR and count 3 PAC.  Sentenced under the IDIP program.
Status conference on August 22, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Robinson in court, in custody. Attorney S. Joseph Randtke appeared by phone means for Defendant Jeffrey Robert Robinson. Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant for defendant's FTA at the FPT on 8/1/16.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Defendant informs the court he only has $100.  Court sets bond at $500 cash.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a for FPT.  Warrant authorized, remove from trial calendar.

Motion to Withdraw by Atty Aaron Olson.  Motion granted.

Final pre-trial on August 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on September 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on September 13, 2016.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for August 1, 2016.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than May 19, 2016. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than May 19, 2016, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Robinson in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NGP entered.  Atty Waters requests modification of bond to allow defendant to be able to go into restaurants to eat.  State doesn't object as long as it's a restaurant and not a bar that serves food.  Court modifies bond to allow defendant to go into a facility for ordering food, eating food & leaving, no drinking.  Defendant inquires if he can play games.  No.  Defendant to stop by clerks office to sign modified bond.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
